description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada


Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

The Data Technology team is looking for a hands-on 
Solutions Architect
 to join our transformational team with a focus on enabling business intelligences, data analytics, and data sciences capabilities.

In this role, the successful candidate will work with partner teams to understand their data, analytics, and data sciences needs, determine the capabilities required to enable and then materialize into roadmaps, functional designs, and systems for Data Products. The ideal candidate understands how the needs of our business partners translate into capabilities enabled by cloud technologies and will then be able to prototype and build cloud-based solutions that also integrate with on-premise systems.



What You’ll Do




 Accountable for enabling successful business outcomes across the Data Technology solution stack with a special focus on designing and helping partner groups build production capabilities and reduce technical debt/risks 

 Provides technical solution leadership, designing for sustainable and repeatable patterns across Data, Data Analytics, Data Sciences, and Data Movement technologies 

 Takes a hands-on approach spanning across design, build, and productionizing solutions 

 Acts as a trusted advisor and cloud adoption advocate by providing specialized advice on cloud migration of existing on-premise solutions 

 Creates and delivers solution communication packages to all levels of stakeholders up to and including the senior leadership team 




What You Bring




 Self-motivated, agile and innovative team member, who can manage in an environment of change and ambiguity 

 Solid understanding and practical experience with fundamental data systems architecture including, but not limited to: various database types, data engineering, data movement, data visualizations, data governance technologies, CICD, and code/model management 

 5+ years of design and hands-on experience in Data, Analytics, Integration technologies 

 2+ years of experience working in a Cloud environment (Azure, GCP or AWS) 

 Ideally has obtained Cloud Architecture Certification for any of the above (Azure preferred) 

 2+ years working in an Agile environment 

 Lived through at least 1 migration of on-premise systems to the Cloud or Hybrid implementation 

 Broad knowledge across foundational technology domains including security, infrastructure, and networking 

 Experience with Infrastructure as code tools such as Ansible, Terraform or CloudFormation 

 Solid understanding of containerization, Kubernetes, DataOps and MLOps is desired 




Education




 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or related field is preferred 

 Certification in one or more of the following technology subject areas is preferred: Cloud, Database, Data, Business Intelligence, Data Science/ML/AI 




About Canadian Tire Corporation



Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies.

To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn.

AODA/D&I statement is populated in Automatic requisitions, must be added to Manual requisitions.

Add reference/background check information statement if applicable.

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


At AWS, we believe in thinking big so you should be motivated to be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge that makes a big impacts to the business and help build the future with us. AWS is looking for an experienced Solutions Architect to help advise our Enterprise customers on how to best adopt and leverage the value of AWS technology. This is an ideal role for someone with experience in various industry, knowledge of enterprise applications, infrastructure and a solid understanding of the transformative value cloud technologies can bring.

As a Solutions Architect (SA), you should partner with customers, AWS Sales, and several other AWS teams to craft highly scalable, flexible, and resilient cloud architectures that address customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of AWS services. In collaboration with sales, you should help drive growth across a broad set of customers. As a trusted customer advocate, you should help organizations understand best practices around advanced cloud-based solutions. You should seek out opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mindshare and broaden the use of the AWS platform across the customer's organization. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges.

As an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Solutions Architect, you are joining a team that invests in your success by providing a comprehensive learning program. The AWS Solutions Architecture team provides an opportunity to work in an open environment that includes self-paced learning, instructor-led training, hands-on projects, and job shadowing opportunities to develop your knowledge of the AWS ecosystem of services and solutions. The ideal candidate has a curious mind, a thirst for knowledge, and a desire to understand how technology works. By working backwards from defined customer outcomes, you achieve results that delight AWS customers. You enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and develop new ones so you can make meaningful contributions to long-term customer success.

Roles and Responsibilities


 Build deep relationships with customers to become a trusted advisor for their most critical workloads that support their digital transformation and journey to the cloud.

 Support achievement of revenue objectives through the adoption and migration of applications, software, and services onto the AWS platform, in partnership with the sales team.

 Educate customers on the value proposition of AWS, and participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.

 Contribute to AWS internal and customer-facing publications such as white-papers and blogs as a means of scaling your knowledge.

 Act as a liaison between customers, service engineering teams, and support to address customer needs.




Travel Requirements




 All travel is temporarily on hold. Under normal circumstances, open to travel within the city or province and up to 25% out of province as required for customer meetings.

 All onboarding training will be virtual.





Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or related field of study OR 8+ years of professional or military work experience

 8+ years within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics)

 3+ years of design, implementation, or consulting experience in applications and infrastructures

 Experience communicating across technical and non-technical audiences, including executive level stakeholders or clients

 7 years in a technical solutions architect role, designing, implementing distributed applications, databases, and networks

 Strong verbal and written communication skills, in French and English




Preferred Qualifications




 Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies (e.g. ITIL, Zachman, TOGAF, etc.)

 Experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS

 Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT managers, and developers

 Hands-on scripting experience (e.g. Python, Perl, JavaScript, JQuery, etc.)

 Technical degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent work experience.




About Us



Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Job ID: A1922311

job_title: Senior Solution Architect - Guest and Educator Engagement
description:
Who We Are




 Description & Requirements 


lululemon is a yoga-inspired technical apparel company up to big things. The practice and philosophy of yoga informs our overall purpose to elevate the world through the power of practice. We are proud to be a growing global company with locations all around the world, from Vancouver to Shanghai, and places in between. We owe our success to our innovative product, our emphasis on our stores, our commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we get to make in every community we are in.



About This Team



The technology collective team is accountable for the strategy, engineering, and delivery of technology to enable educator and guest transactions and experiences in stores and our guest education center, provide B2B capabilities, and provide cross channel enterprise services for Inventory and payments.



A Day In The Life



The Solution Architect partners with delivery teams to architect, design, and build flexible, scalable, and resilient applications and services that can more easily adapt to future business needs.   


Leads the business/functional architecture and strategy for solutions in a manner consistent with lululemon technology's enterprise architecture, applying common frameworks and re-usable components

Helps ensure the operational platforms and associated interfacing data and systems have been properly architected end-to-end to meet the functional and non-functional needs of the business

Brings conceptual design down to a level of detail that can be physically implemented

Ensures as-requested functionality gets translated into as-designed solutions within the context of timeline, resources, org structure and quality  

Works closely with other architects and development teams to support and guide solution implementations and acts as an advisor for technical resources on projects 

Develops and maintains current and future-state architecture models and ensures all documentation is kept up to date

Stays abreast of industry best practices, technologies, architectures, trends, emerging technologies and develop proof-of-concept projects to validate same

Drive common vision, practices and capabilities across teams

Manages technical debt and risks 




Qualifications




Bachelor's Degree in IT Engineering, Computer Science with 10+ years experience

5+ year of hands on software development experience 

5+ years of hands-on architecture or related experience 

10+ years developing real world scaled solutions with knowledge of full application development lifecycle (SDLC) and methodologies; waterfall, agile and hybrid

Understanding and ability to work within architectural frameworks 

Successful track record delivering quality results on complex cross-functional projects 

Strong analytical and problem solving capabilities 

Retail and payment domain experience (highly desired) 

Experience with integration of 3rd party tools and cloud middleware platforms 

Ability to design SaaS solutions that scale and perform with rock solid reliability, ability to identify and build in key application monitoring hooks to allow for optimal solution management 

Ability to work with operations to plan upgrades, troubleshoot issues, and tune systems for optimal performance and uptime 

Provides leadership to junior and senior software engineers; knows how to leverage and enhance their skills 

Ability to use and communicate system design patterns and anti-patterns 

Ability to manage solution architecture design to align to business value 

Ability to strongly justify the proposed architecture and design in a comparative mode 

Ability to develop and manage architecture models such as activity, class, and data models 

Excellent presentation, verbal, written, and listening skills 

Strong presentation and interpersonal skills 

Strong interpersonal and leadership skills including collaboration, facilitation and negotiation




Must Haves




Strong understanding of basic programming concepts and data structure

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

Willingness to learn new technologies

Analytical and logical thinker

Passion for quality and relentless improvement

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


The AWS Migration Acceleration Services team is recruiting a Solutions Architect to help guide customers in the early stages of large scale migrations to the cloud by developing business cases that address customer objectives using AWS tools such as Migration Evaluator, Cloud Endure and Application Discovery Service. Migration Services tools and programs deliver accurate data-driven recommendations to right-size and right-cost compute & storage, perform application dependency mapping, migration wave planning, and more.

In this role, you will work closely with customers and internal teams to help craft migration business cases and ensure customers and internal teams are well supported on their migration assessments. This also includes supporting AWS field teams and AWS Partners as they develop their own assessments using Migration Services tooling. Our service is used by customers, partners, and internal Amazon Web Services teams on a global basis.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a focus on balancing life with work, and does this via work autonomy. Our team is mainly focused on supporting customers and this can mean aligning your daily schedule with your meetings, or your personal needs (appointments, etc). Our team is based in Vancouver, Canada with a global presence across multiple countries and time zones so we're flexible with our team working from home and we record meetings and minutes/agendas to allow for inclusivity of all time zones and availability.

Mentorship & Career Growth

We’re committed to the growth and development of every member of the Migration Evaluator team. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the culture and direction of the Client Delivery team, help improve operational aspects of assessment delivery and will be exposed to high-level cloud planning and financial conversations with a variety of internal and external customers, all with different needs and at different stages in their migration journey.

The Migration Evaluator team is a growth environment - we’re hiring and scaling to meet the needs of our customers. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your scope of influence on our service team naturally as we scale.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Come join a smart, innovative team that’s obsessed with serving its customers and is having fun doing so!




Basic Qualifications




 Experience in software implementation and delivery

 Practical knowledge of computer software, hardware and networks

 Experience interacting with and presenting to customers or internal teams

 Ability to clearly articulate technical concepts to a business audience

 2+ years of experience in Solutions Architect or technical advisory role with similar type experience




Preferred Qualifications




 Familiarity with AWS architecture (S3, EC2, etc.) or AWS Certified SA Professional

 Familiarity with data center and/or cloud infrastructure management

 Familiarity with licensing models and strategies for Windows and SQL, Oracle, Linux


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Job ID: A1930411

Job Description:
 
On behalf of our client, Affinity is seeking a Lead Technical Architect who will act as a technical expert and project lead with experience architecting, designing, developing and deploying applications in a cloud first environment. The Lead Technical Architect works with business stakeholders, members of the wider Architecture group and Project Managers to support our IT ecosystem as they build, run and evolve applications organizationally.




Responsibilities 



Creating and owning innovative technical roadmaps

Acting as a technical subject matter expert to business leaders, advising on technical solutions

Communicating decisions to technical teams and leading them in the solutions

Provide technical leadership in the owned areas of performance, reliability, security and compliance.

Maintain relationships and act as an advocate through regular communication with business managers, Enterprise and Solution Architects and/or development leads, understanding our business, technical objectives, and product requirements

Consult on architecture for application implementations

Lead a small team of architects and provide mentoring through technical and career development

Proactively monitor, raise concerns and suggest project development or architecture best practices

Proactively spot rough edges across implementations and work with partner and customer teams to remove them

Contribute to the IT roadmap and communicate to the wider organization

Work with assigned teams to bridge any technical knowledge gaps 

Developing proof-of-concepts and ensuring proposals are technically sound

Assist including requirements gathering, scoping, and proof of concepts





Qualifications



5 years of experience working with Agile teams on complex application projects including technical design, planning and implementation

Experience developing technical roadmaps

Experience working with commercial off-the-shelf applications to shape solutions with a strong understanding of integrations

Strong communication skills with the ability to adjust messaging for senior executives or technical teams

You have managed direct reports





Top Skills Necessary


 · 
Process improvement/standardization
 – 5+ years of experience improving business performance by documenting key processes, measuring effectiveness, recommend process standardization to identify and execute improvements while maximizing value of current IT investments and strategically outsourcing to achieve scale and cost efficiency.

 · 
Enterprise Cloud Implementations
 – Have acted as an Enterprise architect on at least 2 cloud application implementations throughout the entire development lifecycle from concept development to maintenance.

 · 
Have managed direct reports
 – Provided leadership to others through technical direction, mentorship, onboarding/offboarding and created the necessary organizational relationships to get buy in from others in order to move projects forward.




Affinity Earn:


 Know someone who’s great for this, or any of our open roles? Earn up to $4,000/year for each successful referral through Affinity Earn. Learn about our referral program at   https://affinity-group.ca/earn/   or browse our jobs & follow us at   https://www.linkedin.com/company/affinity-staffing/jobs/ 


About Affinity:


 Affinity is a full service Information Technology agency that takes a unique approach to recruiting. We believe recruiting is about creating long term relationships that foster a mutually beneficial partnership - an affinity. Bringing a new style of recruiting founded on four core principles – Transparency – Flexibility – Efficiency – Agility. For more information on Affinity Staffing, please visit.   www.affinity-group.ca

description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION




Description



Imagine being a part of a team where your ideas have the potential to change companies, reshape industries, and improve the lives of many. Picture working with cutting-edge technology, the most dynamic businesses, and a talented & inclusive team. Envision being able to leverage the resources of a Fortune-10 company within the atmosphere of a start-up. Welcome to Amazon Web Services, where you can have fun while making history. Come and help build the future with us as a Solutions Architect.

As a Solutions Architect (SA), you will partner with customers, AWS Sales, and several other AWS teams to craft highly scalable, flexible, and resilient cloud architectures that address customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of AWS services. In collaboration with sales, you will help drive revenue growth across a broad set of customers. As a trusted customer advocate, you will help organizations understand best practices around advanced cloud-based solutions. You will seek out opportunities to help shape and execute strategies to build mind share and broaden the use of the AWS platform across customer organization. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges.

As an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Solutions Architect, you are joining a team that invests in your success by providing a comprehensive learning program. The AWS Solutions Architecture team provides an opportunity to work in an open environment that includes self-paced learning, instructor-led training, hands-on projects, and job shadowing opportunities to develop your knowledge of the AWS ecosystem of services and solutions. The ideal candidate has a curious mind, a thirst for knowledge, and a desire to understand how technology works. By working backwards from defined customer outcomes, you achieve results that delight AWS customers. You enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and develop new ones so you can make meaningful contributions to long-term customer success.

Roles and Responsibilities


 Build deep relationships with customers to become a trusted advisor for their most critical workloads that support their digital transformation and journey to the cloud.

 Educate customers on the value proposition of AWS, and participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.

 Open to travel within the city or province and up to 10-15% out of province as required for customer meetings.

 AWS training during on-boarding process, (typically first 3 months) can require travel to the USA for up to 5 consecutive days.




About Us

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

 8+ years within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics)

 3+ years of design, implementation, or consulting experience in applications and infrastructures

 Experience communicating across technical and non-technical audiences, including executive level stakeholders or clients





Basic Qualifications




 7 years in a technical solutions architect role, designing, implementing distributed applications, databases, and networks.

 Strong verbal and written communication skills.





Preferred Qualifications




PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS



 Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies (e.g. ITIL, Zachman, TOGAF, etc.)

description:
nCino offers exciting career opportunities for individuals who want to join the worldwide leader in cloud banking.

The Saleforce.com Solution Architect helps customers to analyze their current architecture, define their target and develop a roadmap to implement our leading Bank Operating System built on Salesforce. You will then help them to realize the benefits of our Bank Operating System by being the Technical Lead for the Enterprise Delivery Team.



Responsibilities




 Work with nCino implementation team consisting of Banking, Configuration, Integration and Product Development SME(s) to define the work breakdown and detailed tasks 

 Utilize an Agile process to assess a customer's current state, determine future state, understand the gaps and put in place a repeatable systematic implementation plan for 12+ month implementations at major enterprise banks, globally 

 Communicate to technical, business and executive customer stakeholders to set appropriate expectations related to customer commitment and requisite resource allocation for a successful deployment and confirm schedule 

 Analyze the current and future state data, technical, application and business architecture needed, verify and modify recommended implementation plan based on customer input and existing/inflight customer projects 

 Following final solution architecture delivery recommendation by the nCino team, assist in design and troubleshooting during implementation in order to ensure final architecture meets client business needs and maintains alignment with nCino core product development direction 

 Assist in future communication, training structure, etc. to establish repeatable process for onboarding additional Enterprise Bank Implementation Consultants. Train on methodology including streamlining, simplification and automation of tasks 

 Work closely with nCino Support to resolve customer data cases 

 Handle multiple projects effectively while continuing to deliver exceptional quality 

 Work independently and prioritize time and projects appropriately 

 Think out of the box to come up with creative solutions to customer issues 

 Translate customer requirements into implementation plans 

 Drive customer success with a team player attitude 




Qualifications




 Bachelor of Science or Master’s Degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent experience 

 6+ years’ experience with Salesforce.com architecture experience or combination experience, education, & superior performance 

 Salesforce.com Developer 401 and Administrator 201 certifications 

 Experience with the analysis, definition and implementation Solution, Information, Technical, Application Architecture based solutions 

 Knowledge/Experience of various data encryption methods 

 Passion to deliver the high quality solution to banking customers with an all-in commitment to what we do 



 Desired 



 Large FI experience, particularly with the Loan Origination/Servicing Systems, Enterprise Architecture framework 




Travel Requirements




 Position requires approximately 50% travel. Candidate must be willing to travel as needed in order to accomplish required team goals and continue to foster team cohesiveness 



If you thrive in a high-energy, entrepreneurial environment, we invite you to share your passion, ideas and excitement at nCino.


nCino provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability, genetics or other protected groups. In addition to federal law requirements, nCino complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

nCino is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, nCino will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact us at recruiting@ncino.com .

Our commitment to inclusion and equality includes a strong belief that the diversity of our team is instrumental to our success. We strive to create workplaces where employees are empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.

Job ID: A1934625

Job Description


As a Software Architect for cloud solutions, you will be a part of the team leading the company’s cloud/SaaS technology development and contributing to the development of future offerings. You will have the opportunity to participate in shaping the company’s future through collaboration with highly skilled domain experts and developers alongside with dedicated leaders.





Roles and Responsibilities



Lead the work on selecting the technologies and patterns needed for supporting the future business needs

Help shape the software platform serve cloud-based customer needs

Advise the business units in the company on strategic paths involving technology choices and how to balance the combination of business and technology

Be a software architect mentor to the rest of the engineering team

Work in cross-functional agile teams to produce and release new applications, features, and enhancements to improve the user experience, applying the full understanding of software engineering discipline and industry best practices

Design and rapidly prototype proposed solutions in different Tech Stacks

Work closely with other Architects and the development team members in major architecture projects, design and implementation, review of functional and technical requirements









Qualifications and Experience



Proven track record of translating complex business needs into a simple and effective software architecture and solutions suitable for SaaS offerings

Good understanding of Inter-process Communication, Microservices and distributed infrastructure

Extensive experience designing, developing, and deploying software on Amazon AWS and/or Microsoft Azure

Hands on experience with backend (e.g. DotNet) and frontend Technologies (e.g. Angular) – with a drive to learn new ones as needed

Experience with Windows and Linux stacks

Good communication skills and be able to convey complex technical ideas/concepts to wide range of developers with varying levels of experience

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or related field

Comfortable working in an Agile/SCRUM development process






Nice to have:



Fluent in Linux/Unix command

Comfortable translating design ideas to easy-to-understand documentation

Experience with using and scripting in PowerShell Core

Passionate for software development and architecture

495148BR


Introduction


At IBM, we know that transformation drives change, and it is in our DNA to continuously transform. Our Business Transformation Consultants help drive large scale change that spans IBM business units and geographies. As a part of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to be a part of driving IBM’s ongoing transformation as a company that continuously innovates and leads the market.


Your Role and Responsibilities



Introduction To The Company


IBM Consulting is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

At IBM, work is more than a job — it's a calling. To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. To lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems.

Let's put smart to work.


Key Responsibilities


As an IBM Solution Architect, you directly help clients transform their business and solve complex problems, driving their sustainability agenda. You will define the scope and vision for projects that deliver customized solutions using your knowledge of IBM Cloud, Data and AI technologies. You are a technical leader, serving as a liaison among business partners, technical resources, and project stakeholders.


Responsibilities Would Include




Be the overall technical lead and single point of contact for client-facing IBM Client Engineering engagements and be able to connect a client’s business challenges to a broad range of cloud technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, Cloud Foundry, Container

Security, Red Hat technologies (OpenShift, Ansible, RHEL, etc.), and related IBM cloud, data/AI products and services

Own the solutions architecture plan while being a “hands-on” builder in a client-facing engagement

Ensure that the solution architecture includes sufficient provisions for security and reliability, while covering customer pain points and anticipated future needs

Perform engagement lead duties to ensure streamlined communications as well as ownership of tasks across the client’s and IT technical team for one or more IBM Client Engineering engagements

Champion an entrepreneurial mindset and deliver unique value by leveraging industry and technology expertise to drive innovative strategies to accelerate clients’ success

Continuously expand essential business, industry, technology, and competitive knowledgeSkills and attributes

Primary focus is delivery and has delivered complex / large scale projects

Pre-sales experience is an asset

Experience with cloud native technologies such as containerization, orchestration and event driven architecture preferred

Application experience with Java Springboot, nodejs or other similar coding technologies

Data experience with data modelling APIs or persistent data models

Cloud experience with one of the major cloud providers, Azure, AWS, GCP, IBM Cloud




Skills and attributes




Primary focus is delivery and has delivered complex / large scale projects

Pre-sales experience is an asset

Experience with cloud native technologies such as containerization, orchestration and event driven architecture preferred

Application experience with Java Springboot, nodejs or other similar coding technologies

Data experience with data modelling APIs or persistent data models

Cloud experience with one of the major cloud providers, Azure, AWS, GCP, IBM Cloud




What working here offers


What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge? Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise




At least 5+ years of experience leading customer-facing technical solutions teams in architecting, building and delivering complex application modernization and cloud native, hybrid, and multi-cloud solutions (e.g, AWS, Azure, IBM Cloud, GCP)

At least 2 years of hands-on experience in designing and implementing enterprise container solutions using container engines such a as Kubernetes, Docker, Cloud Foundry, Red Hat technologies (OpenShift, Ansible, RHEL, etc.)

Client facing advisory or consultancy experience in technical projects and services with strong ability to articulate complex application and solution architecture discussions and to connect them to the client’s business challenges and context

Proven experience with modern application development techniques and best practices such as agile methodologies, API and microservice architectures, and cloud-native application patterns

Hands-on experience with software development frameworks such as Java, JavaScript, Spring, ReactJS, AngularJS, NodeJS, Ruby on Rails

Strong organizational, planning and team collaboration skills with the ability to work on multiple projects at the same time




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


As above.

Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

job_title: AWS Architecte de Solutions Partenaires | AWS Partner Solutions Architect
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Français (English to follow)

Voulez-vous aider certains des Intégrateurs Systèmes les plus connus à utiliser les technologies infonuagiques? Avez-vous le coup pour aider les compagnies à comprendre les architectures applicatives et les approches intégrées? Voulez-vous faire partie de l’équipe d’architectes de solutions qui aident à faire d’Amazon Web Services (AWS) la première plateforme infonuagique?

En tant qu’Architecte de Solutions Partenaires chez AWS, axé sur les intégrateurs de systèmes, vous aurez l’opportunité d’aider à façonner et à mettre en œuvre une stratégie visant à renforcer le partage d’idées et l’utilisation à grande échelle des services infonuagiques et utilitaires d’Amazon au sein de la communauté des partenaires.

Vous posséderez des compétences techniques approfondies en architecture logicielle et infonuagique, ainsi que des compétences pour le contact avec les clients à tous les niveaux d’une organisation partenaire. Vous devriez également avoir une capacité établie à penser stratégiquement aux défis commerciaux, produits et techniques.

Ce poste est situé à Montréal, Canada.



Équilibre Travail/vie Personnelle



Notre équipe accorde également une grande valeur à l’équilibre travail-vie personnelle. Trouver un équilibre sain entre votre vie personnelle et professionnelle est crucial pour votre bonheur et votre succès, c’est pourquoi nous ne nous concentrons pas sur le nombre d’heures que vous passez au travail ou en ligne. Au lieu de cela, nous sommes heureux d’offrir des horaires flexibles afin que vous puissiez avoir une vie plus productive et bien équilibrée, aussi bien au travail qu’à l’extérieur.



Mentorat Et Croissance De Carrière



Notre équipe se consacre à soutenir les nouveaux membres. Nous avons un large éventail de niveaux d’expérience et de mandats, et nous créons un environnement qui célèbre le partage des connaissances et le mentorat. Nous nous soucions de la croissance de votre carrière et nous nous efforçons d’attribuer des projets en fonction de ce qui aidera chaque membre de l’équipe à devenir un professionnel mieux équilibré et leur permettra d’assumer des tâches plus complexes à l’avenir.



Culture Diverse Et Inclusive



Chez AWS, nous embrassons nos différences. Nous sommes déterminés à promouvoir notre culture d’inclusion. Nous avons des groupes d’affinités, dirigés par les employés, couvrant 40000 employés dans plus de 190 chapitres a travers le monde. Nous offrons des avantages sociaux novateurs et nous organisons des expériences d’apprentissages continues et annuelles, y compris nos conférences Conversations sur la race et l’ethnicité (CORE) et AmazeCon (diversité de genre). La culture d’inclusion d’Amazon est renforcée dans nos 16 principes directeurs (Leadership Principles), qui rappellent aux membres de nos équipes le besoin de rechercher des perspectives diverses, d’apprendre et d’être curieux et de gagner la confiance.



Exigences En Matière De Déplacements



Vous devez être ouvert aux déplacements dans la ville ou la province, et jusqu’à 25% a l’extérieur de la province, au besoin pour les réunions clients. Tous les voyages sont temporairement suspendus.

Would you like to help some of the best known Systems Integrators in the world utilize cloud computing technologies? Do you have a knack for helping companies understand application architectures and integration approaches? Do you want to be part of the solutions architecture team helping to establish Amazon Web Services (AWS) as the leading cloud computing platform?

As a Partner Solutions Architect focused on SI’s within AWS, you will have the opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon's utility computing web services across the partner community. Your broad responsibilities will include owning the technical engagement with strategic partners.

You will possess deep technical skills in software architecture and cloud computing as well as customer facing skills at all levels of a partner organization. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.

This position is located in Montreal, Canada.

Work/Life Balance

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive and Diverse Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Travel Requirements

Open to travel within the city or province and up to 25% out of province as required for customer meetings. All travel is temporarily on hold.

Key job responsibilities


 En tant que membre stratégique de l’équipe d’Architectes de Solutions d’AWS, vous agirez en tant que conseiller de confiance pour nos intégrateurs de systèmes gérés.

 Fournir les conseils en architecture et les recommandations nécessaires pour promouvoir les engagement réussis des partenaires à travers le monde.

 Aider les fournisseurs de solutions dans la définition de stratégies techniques qui leur permettront de vendre leurs offres sur la plateforme AWS.

 Capturer et partager les connaissances sur les meilleures pratiques avec notre plus large communauté d’architectes de solutions.

 Partager les retours des partenaires et des clients avec les équipes produits et ingénierie internes afin d’aider à guider le futur d’AWS.

 As a strategic member of the AWS Solution Architect team, you will act as a trusted advisor to our managed systems integrators

 Provide the architectural guidance and recommendations necessary to promote successful partner engagements worldwide

 Assist solution providers with the definition of technical strategies that will enable them to sell more of their offering on the AWS platform

 Capture and share best-practice knowledge with our broader Solutions Architect community

 Share partner and customer feedback to internal product management and engineering teams to help drive the future of AWS


** For more information on Amazon Web Services, please visit http://aws.amazon.com **




Basic Qualifications



Plus de 5 ans d’expérience pratique dans la mise en œuvre ou le conseil, et 2 ans ou plus dans des rôles clients et/ou partenaires.

5+ years of hands on implementation or consulting experience

2+ years in a customer and/or partner facing roles



Preferred Qualifications




 Expérience de travail dans le développement de logiciels ou dans des industries liées a Internet, dans un rôle de conseil technique avant-vente.

 Expérience de la migration ou de la transformation de solutions clientes vers le nuage.

 Expérience de travail avec les communautés d’utilisateurs finaux ou des développeurs.

 Expérience de travail efficace aussi bien en interne qu’en externe.

 Connaissances des solutions d’entreprise courantes de Microsoft, Oracle et SAP.

 Expérience professionnelle des solutions d’architecture et d’exploitation construites sur AWS.

 Formation en informatique, en mathématiques ou techniques hautement souhaitées. Un diplôme d’études supérieures est un plus.

 Expérience passée de rédaction et de publication de livres blancs techniques.

 Experience working within software development or Internet-related industries in a technical pre-sales consulting role

 Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud

 Experience working with end user or developer communities

 Experience working effectively across internal and external organizations

 Familiarity with common enterprise solutions from Microsoft, Oracle, and SAP

 Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS

 Computer Science, Math or Technical background highly desired; Advanced Degree a plus

 Past experience writing and publishing technical white papers


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Amazon s’engage à créer un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif. Amazon est un employeur qui offre à tous les mêmes opportunités et ne fait pas de discrimination fondée sur la race, l’origine nationale, le sexe, l’identité sexuelle, l’orientation sexuelle, le statut d’ancien combattant protégé, le handicap, l’âge ou autres statuts protégés par la loi. Les personnes handicapées qui souhaitent présenter une demande d’accommodement, sont invitées à aviser leur recruteur.



Company
 - Amazon Web Services Canada, In
