description:
Job title: Senior Java Solutions Architect


Job Location: Mississauga, ON CAN



Job Summary




Review and approve the design and development of both server-side and client-side applications. 

Determine and develop architectural approaches and solutions, conduct reviews, document current systems, and develop recommendations on how to proceed with the applications. 

Oversee application systems, architecture, design, data workflow, logical processes, and system interfaces. 

Experience in modern API driven web application development with NodeJS, Java, Python, Java Script, HTML, CSS, JQuery


Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Job Posting : Feb 14 2022



About Cognizant



Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Who is Innovapost?


Great question! We are the technology arm of the Canada Post Group of companies. This includes Canada Post, Purolator, and SCI. By joining us you will be able to make a positive impact on how every Canadian deliver and receives their packages and mail. Next time you see your neighbor picking up their mail and receiving a package, you will be able to say “you’re welcome!”


What role will you play?


Reporting to the CITO Group Head, the Solution Integration Architect (“SIA”) provides overarching architecture direction for the entire business solution delivery team and the strategic projects. The Solution Integration Architect provides technical leadership to business partners and internal stakeholders regarding the integration of systems, software, and processes. The SIA ensures solutions meet business needs along with architecturally significant functional and non-functional requirements. The Solution Integration Architect is a senior role in the architecture family. The SIA works with the Business Solution Delivery Lead and the Enterprise Architecture team to define multi-year technology roadmaps. In collaboration with solution architects, this individual initiates the architecture blueprints that establish the specific standards and patterns that will be used by development teams.

In addition, the SIA will be the point of contact for the enterprise view of the Obsolescence Risk Management and working with the SIA across the enterprise to establish a roadmap for business applications to avoid obsolete system components.

CPG technical environment is very diverse with SAP at its core plus over 400 custom applications supporting the business operations. The infrastructure includes private and vendor cloud environments, with a large data centre footprint.


What will you be responsible for? (Apart from Innovating)



Provide leadership in the logical and physical system design, and ensure design is consistent and well integrated with existing conceptual, logical, and physical architectures, in collaboration with the Business Domain Architect

Collaborate with Architecture COE on the solution design to ensure it complies with enterprise architectural standards and roadmaps and collaborate with Enterprise Architecture to ensure alignment on future roadmaps and IT Strategies

Facilitate and enable the integration of applications, services and business processes using common methodologies

Provide architectural oversight on all Internal IT (investment) projects that enhance Innovapost IT practices and/or employee experiences

Provide career and professional guidance to the assigned team of two Solution Architects.

Develop an end-to-end solution architecture that accurately translates business requirements to technology and ensures the design will meet business requirements throughout the lifecycle of a change




Additional Responsibilities




Develop, maintain, and communicate processes and standard practices related to the design, development, and implementation of application solutions on a project basis

Develop, maintain, and communicate Obsolescence Risk Management process and standard practices to keep a clear view of the system software support roadmaps and the impact on the applications across the enterprise. 

Participate in tier 3 application support activities including incident management and the assessment and delivery of application upgrades and patches

Analyze and estimate feasibility, costs, time, and resources needed to develop and implement solutions (high level)

In collaboration with the Enterprise Architect and the Architecture COE, research and evaluate software technology, products, and solutions, and make recommendations on technology/production introduction, phase-out and retirement

Assist in application portfolio management, standards development, maintenance and governance

Work across the CPGC to understand and leverage common solution components where appropriate



What skills do you need for this role to be yours?



Client Management: can consolidate business requirements and translate them into solution architecture

Architecture design: experienced in several technology architecture design or re-design efforts

Solution design: familiar with workflow concepts and how they integrate with application solutions in a cross applications context

Value Management: can identify the effectiveness and completeness of business and technology strategies and ensure alignment with clients and other applicable cross-organization strategies

Domain knowledge: experience in relevant IT domain and business domain

Minimum of 3 or more years' experience as a Solution Integration Architect or equivalent role at a major company

Minimum 5 years’ experience as a Solution, Business, or Data Architect.

Minimum 10 years’ experience in progressively advancing roles within IT.




Additional Skills That Set You Apart




A mature perspective on architecture and its role in a dynamic company

Broad knowledge of existing technologies and interest in emerging trends and innovations

Exceptional interpersonal skills in areas such as teamwork, facilitation and negotiation



Education



Academic: undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, business, or equivalent (required), Graduate degree in Business Administration (MBA)(Asset)



Competencies


Be Courageous

Innovate

Be Inclusive

Inspire

Be Curious

Technical Knowledge

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Overview



At Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too.

We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled.

We are a leading-edge digital consultancy where team members build their careers solving complex and interesting business problems for great brands and clients. Clients love us because we fuse strategy, creative and technology into data-driven solutions – and we bring the full weight of a tech-savvy consulting firm to support our best-of-breed digital consultancy.

Our national Commerce Practice team is comprised of passionate and capable strategists, architects, project managers, business analysts, developers, and infrastructure specialists who specialize in the designing and implementing of industry leading eCommerce and Order Management platforms. We deliver on the promise of a unified commerce experience, through strategic discussion aligned to business needs. We use an agnostic approach with a deep portfolio of options to address all levels of digital maturity. We are experts on the leading Commerce and Order Management platforms including HCL Commerce, Adobe Commerce (Magento), Optimizely (Insite), Znode, SalesForce, InRiver PIM, Akeneo, KIBO, and IBM Sterling OMS.

Perficient has more than 20 years of experience working with the IBM Sterling platform, and honored to be recognized as IBM Sterling Order Management solution Partner of the Year since 2018. Implementing solutions for some of the world’s most recognizable brands, our firm’s order management practice ( https://www.perficient.com/what-we-do/platforms-and-technology/oms ) is focused on helping clients optimize their supply chain. This includes but is not limited to work that provides a companies a global view of their inventory and then optimizing corresponding order execution all the while maintain transparency throughout the fulfillment process.

Perficient currently has a career opportunity for a 
Senior Order Management Solutions Architect
 in our National Commerce Practice in the United States and/or Canada.



Job Overview



A Senior Solutions Architect is expected to be or become knowledgeable in two or more technologies within (a given Solutions/Practice area). The Solutions Architect may or may not have a programming background but will have expert architecture, solution design, client interaction skills, team leadership and thought leadership skills.

You will provide best-fit architectural solutions for one or more projects; you will assist in defining scope and sizing of work; provide solution architecture for the business problem, platform integration with third party services, designing and developing complex features for clients' business needs. You will collaborate with some of the best talent in the industry to create and implement innovative high quality solutions, participate in Sales and various pursuits focused on our clients' business needs.

You will also contribute in a variety of roles in thought leadership, mentorship, systems analysis, architecture, design, configuration, testing, debugging, and documentation. You will challenge your leading edge solutions, consultative and business skills through the diversity of work in multiple industry domains. This role is considered part of the Business Unit Senior Leadership team and may mentor junior architects and other delivery team members.



Responsibilities




 Own and aggressively drive forward specific areas of technology architecture. Provide architectural solutions/designs to project execution teams for implementation. 

 Provide architectural assessments, strategies, and roadmaps for one or more technology domains. 

 Lead projects within architecture. Work with Product Owner/Business Analysts to understand functional requirements and interact with other cross-functional teams to architect, design, develop, test, and release features. 

 Project and solution estimation and team structure definition 

 Develop Proof-of-Concept projects to validate new architectures and solutions. 

 Support multiple Agile Scrum teams with planning, scoping and creation of technical solutions for the new product capabilities, through to continuous delivery to production. 

 Liaise with offshore team and clients for resolving technical dependencies, issues, and risks. 

 Mentor and provide architectural guidance to multiple teams building innovative applications. 

 Drive common vision, practices and capabilities across teams. 

 Engage with business stakeholders to understand required capabilities, integrating business knowledge with technical solutions 

 Engage with Technical Architects and technical staff to determine the most appropriate technical strategy and designs to meet business needs 

 Demonstrate broad solutions technical leadership, impacting significant technical direction, exerting influence outside of the immediate team and driving change 




Qualifications




 Minimum 10-15 years of professional experience with IBM Sterling OMS. 

 Leadership and team management experience with ability to provide strategic planning and oversight. 

 At least 5 project implementations that exploit the full capabilities (discover, design, implement and optimize) of the IBM Sterling OMS– is a MUST. 

 At least 5 years of experience in a professional services company, consulting firm, or agency. 

 Have a solid understanding of delivery methodology and lead teams in the implementation of the solution according to the design/architecture. 

 Experience in project and solution estimation and team structure definition. 

 Fluent and current on architecture trends with an eye on market/technical conditions and future direction. 

 Experience in defining new architectures and ability to drive an independent project from an architectural stand point. 

 Experience leading customer workshop sessions to educate customers on the latest technology trends and best practices. 

 Proven record of accomplishment of leadership roles delivering solutions within defined timeframes. 

 Demonstrated success in performing work and managing complex and/or large consulting projects. 

 Proficient in authoring, editing and presenting technical documents. 

 Ability to elicit requirements and communicate clearly with non-technical individuals, development teams, and other ancillary project members. 

 Excellent written and oral communication skills; Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical staff. 

 Experience working with a globally distributed team and managing off-shore teams. 

 Desire to mentor younger team members and develop their skills. 

 Experience working on multiple concurrent projects. 

 Experience leading internal initiatives. 

 Excellent problem-solving skills. 

 Be independent and self-driven. 

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field. 

 Must be open to travel. 




Preferred Skills And Education




 Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field 


Perficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work.



More About Perficient



Perficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000 and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient and its Perficient Digital agency deliver vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions.

Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Perficient's professionals serve clients from a network of offices across North America and offshore locations in India and China. Traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, Perficient is a member of the Russell 2000 index and the S&P SmallCap 600 index.

Perficient is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national, origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.


 Disclaimer: 
 The above statements are not intended to be a complete statement of job content, rather to act as a guide to the essential functions performed by the employee assigned to this classification. Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties of the position at any time.

Select work authorization questions to ask when applicants apply


 Are you legally authorized to work in the United States?

 Will you now, or in the future, require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H-1B visa status)?

job_title: Cloud Solution Architect – Data and Analytics
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Hardware Manufacturing, and Software Development
description:
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

Microsoft aspires to help our customers achieve their own digital transformation, leveraging the power of Microsoft Cloud solutions and support offerings. To this end, Microsoft invests in a dedicated
 Customer Success team
 that will help Microsoft customers successfully realize their business outcomes.

Azure is the most comprehensive, innovative, and flexible cloud platform today and Microsoft is hiring professionals that will drive customer cloud adoption within the most important companies in the market. We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference.


To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit: https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture

Check out all our products at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-ca




We Are Looking For a Highly Motivated And Passionate Cloud Solution Architect With Hands-on Implementation Experience In Data And Analytics Space, Covering One Or More Of The Following




Cloud Data Analytics

Data Modernization

Data Warehousing

Business Intelligence

Data Governance


Practical knowledge of the technologies and products in your area of expertise, hands-on experience with solution delivery is a must. The immediate team you will be a part of interacts closely with customers, product groups for the respective technologies, global field roles such as Cloud Solution Architects, Customer Engineers, Customer Success Account Managers as well as senior leadership team. This is a highly dynamic, high pace position requiring technical depth, agility and independent decision making while dealing with ambiguity. There are ample opportunities for learning on the job to deepen your technical depth and acquire breadth in a variety of technologies.


#customersuccesscanada




Responsibilities




Understand market demand and customers’ data estate, including common workloads, use patterns and business priorities and needs, focusing in the specific area of expertise

Apply technical knowledge to help implement solutions, help solve technical customer problems; build technical collateral

Understand current technical capabilities of the Azure and competing products and platforms

Identify opportunities for improvement and enhancement based on customer, field and internal stakeholder feedback and help incorporate them into the overall technical strategy

Help define and drive end-to-end programs for execution of the technical strategy

Serve as the technical lead and interface between Azure field teams and Azure Engineering in respective areas and help with content delivery when/where needed

Working with multiple customers to create Proof of concepts (POCs) / Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) etc. and guiding customers through to production deployment and operationalization of projects 

Ensure that solution exhibits high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, repeatability, appropriate reusability and reliability upon deployment

Be an Azure Platform evangelist with customers, partners and external communities

Build and grow Data & Analytics communities by driving activities including OpenHack, Workshop




Qualifications



Required/Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field AND 8+ years experience in technology solutions, practice development, architecture, consulting, and/or cloud/infrastructure technologies


OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field AND 6+ years experience in technology solutions, practice development, architecture, consulting, and/or cloud/infrastructure technologies

OR equivalent experience.





Additional Knowledge And Skills




Experience working with large Enterprise customers and field communities in consulting or similar roles, leading deployment projects, architecture, design, implementation, and support of highly distributed applications OR: experience in building products and services as part of Engineering teams in engineering positions.

Ability to run complex program management at a global scale, including cross-project planning and resource orchestration, as well as the ability to consistently identify and drive program enhancements.

Strategic thinking with the ability to execute cross-org and drive for results in ambiguous environments, independence in decision making, ability to problem-solve.

Proven ability to quickly adapt in rapidly evolving business situations

Experience in managing various stakeholder relationships to get consensus on solutions/projects.

Proven track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts, and ensuring follow-through with exceptional verbal and written communication

Strong Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences and with different levels of an organization



Technical



Deep domain expertise in one of the Data-specific areas, such as SQL Server, deployments and migrations to the cloud, Open-source database deployments and migrations, Cloud Scale Analytics, Data Governance, etc. OR hands-on experience working with the respective products at the expert level. Required

Hands-on experience and technical expertise with respective products and technologies.

Working knowledge of Azure and/or competitive cloud technologies.

Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs.

Certification in one or more of the following technologies: Azure Data, Analytics, Big Data.




Experience




Prior work experience in a Consulting/Architecture position within a software and/or services company.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
Solution Architect (Data Focus)






Position Summary:


The Solution Architect role requires an individual with a minimum of 8-10 years of experience who possesses a wide range of solution architecture, data architecture and integration experience from a data perspective. The Solution Architect is a key technical leadership position that will help set the technical direction, enhancing solutions, providing architectural leadership in solution design, application design, data warehouse, ETL and analytic deliverables. The candidate must be a problem solver who has acute attention to detail, but able to maintain and drive towards the big picture solution. The candidate must have exceptional communication skills, and be good at mitigating risk and addressing concerns pro-actively. The architect will liaise with internal staff to interpret business demands to design and deliver solutions with a flexible data foundation that will support a dynamic analytics environment. The candidate must have a technical background in solution architecture, reporting and analytics, ETL tools and methodology, and various modeling techniques (Application, Data Warehouse, Data Marts, etc.).





Position Scope: No revenue or budget accountability



People Management: No Management or Supervision responsibilities



Reporting to: Director, Data Analytics and Reporting



 



Responsibilities: 


· Lead data architecture discussion and design, overseeing design of the information architecture for full solutions, applications, data lakes, data warehouses, data marts and staging areas

· Provide technical leadership in all phases of a project from discovery and planning, through implementation and delivery

· Collaborates with project managers and business leaders for all projects involving enterprise data

· Take leadership in addressing data-related problems relating to system integration, compatibility and multiple-platform integration

· Identify and develop opportunities for data reuse, migration or retirement

· Work through all stages of a data solution life cycle: analyze/profile data, create conceptual, logical and physical data model designs, provide guidance on ETL and analytics solutions

· Oversee standardization of data definition, development of data models, and data quality practices

· Participate in data strategy and road map exercises

· Participate in troubleshooting and performance optimization with the BI and Data Engineering teams

 

Qualifications:

 

· A Bachelor's Degree in a technology area, preferable in Computer Science or Engineering

· 8-10+ years equivalent work experience in Information Technology

· 5+ years of hands-on experience in Requirements and Data Analysis, Data Architecture and/or Data Warehousing in an enterprise data environment

· Experience and proven success in leadership roles supporting business analytics, data governance, data management and data quality

· Hands on experience with enterprise data architectures and toolsets, including relational, 3NF and dimensional models

· Experience with data integration tools (e.g. IBM DataStage, Microsoft SSIS), RDMS (e.g. SQL Server, MySQL) and BI Tools ( e.g. Cognos, SSRS, Tableau)

· Experience in Big Data modeling and methodologies (Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and setting up data exploration and algorithm execution environments for data science teams

· Excellent data analysis and problem-solving skills, with a superior attention to detail

· Highly organized, self-motivated, customer oriented and able to work independently as well as within a team

· Ability to communicate across all levels of the organization, with both technical and business stakeholders

· Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions

· Highly flexible and able to quickly adapt to changing priorities.

Description


Are you looking for a new career challenge? Do you desire to work in the technology industry and still be able to have a balanced work-life? Do you want to work for an established company with a global presence? Does the idea of working on new technology, including Machine Learning and IoT excite you? If so, this opportunity may be perfect for you.




Willowglen is looking for a 
Solutions Architect
 to be part of a first-class team. The key to being successful in this position will be your innovation, passion for new and interesting work and your ability to meet deadlines! Of course, teamwork and quality are very important to us. The Solutions Architect works with the internal team and clients around the globe to understand the overall vision and come up with innovative solutions to solve complex problems that align with systems engineering best practices.





Job Title:
 Solutions Architect


Number of Positions: 
1


Location: 
Edmonton, Alberta (Head Office) / Calgary


Type: 
Full Time


Experience: 
7+ years of industrial experience





What You’ll Do



Design, customize, and monitor the implementation of enterprise SCADA control center solutions that fulfill customer’s operational performance needs

Create architecture solution design deliverables consistent with the Solution Architecture Life Cycle (SDLC)

Review customers’ existing systems and recommend design improvements

Perform comprehensive reviews of solution artifacts such as design reports and interface communication documents

Assist software application developers and other project resources defining specific solution components with technical issues and decisions consistent with architecture standards and plans.

Raise project risks when project solutions deviate from the original plan

Develop and maintain working knowledge of the processes and tools used by Willowglen to manage the enterprise architecture

Engage with software development, IT operations personnel, and other subject matter experts

Facilitate internal and customer meetings

Work with sales teams on the development of technical solution bids and quotes






What You’ll Have



Proven Complex Problem Solver: Able to look into an issue with large unknowns and break it up into smaller more tractable issues.

Able to pick up and utilize new technologies and concepts in very short time frames.

Effectively communicate technical issues, concepts, solutions to non-technical people so as to build consensus, trust, and decisions.

BSc in Engineering, Computer Science, or comparable area of studies – or equivalent.

Skilled in system design and delivery methodology (TOGAF, IEC15288, or equivalent)






Bonus Points



Discipline, organizational and time management skills to work with a high amount of autonomy while delivering results.

Experience with the following technologies:

SQL and No-SQL databases (Redis, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite)

Streaming technologies (Kafka, Redis Streams)

UNIX based operating systems (RedHat, CentOS)

Messaging Queues (MQTT, RabbitMQ)

Virtualization, Containers and Container Orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker, RKE2)

Machine Learning



 



Requirements



Canadian Resident, based in Alberta





Willowglen Systems offers great benefits such as comprehensive Health and Dental coverage, paid time off, paid volunteering time, Tuition reimbursement, wellness program and flexible schedule. We encourage a balanced work-life and provide opportunities for training and growth.




Willowglen Systems (www.willowglensystems.com) has serviced the global automation industry with pioneering technology for over 50 years. With our product development teams proudly centred in our Canadian head office, Willowglen is a company built upon the pillars of innovation, reliability, outstanding customer service, and corporate social responsibility. We have a long history of strong working relationships with our customers, partners, and industry experts – developed through our commitment to teamwork and providing superior, award-winning solutions, and community-mindedness.




Willowglen Systems Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce.

job_title: Architecte de solutions sénior - Services-conseils en gestion de patrimoine
description:
Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.


Niveau d'emploi


NV-11

À titre d'Architecte de solutions sénior - Services-conseils en gestion de patrimoine, vous contribuez à l'élaboration, au suivi et au maintien de la feuille de route de ce vaste domaine d'activité, comprenant le marché des capitaux et valeurs mobilières Desjardins.

Vous assumez un rôle de leadership et d’influence auprès des équipes TI afin de permettre à nos solutions numériques d'être simples, sécuritaires et disponibles sur différents canaux.

Vous formulez des recommandations relatives à l’architecture de solutions, au développement et à la réalisation de dossiers ou de projets à complexité opérationnelle et conceptuelle très élevée. Ceux-ci nécessitent une analyse et une compréhension globale et approfondie du domaine d’affaires et de l’organisation. Les arrimages sont nombreux. Vous êtes appelé à interagir avec un très grand nombre de parties prenantes œuvrant dans des domaines d’expertise variés. La maîtrise des relations interpersonnelles devient alors une compétence essentielle.

Vous exercez un rôle d’expert-conseil et de contenu dans votre domaine et agissez à titre de personne-ressource et de coach auprès de la haute direction et des instances.


Responsabilités principales



Agir à titre de responsable pour l’arrimage transversale de solutions touchant plusieurs « domaines » de la gestion de patrimoine

Les différents sites Web du secteur (front et back-end) et leurs canaux d'acquisition et de relation clients

Connaître le fonctionnement de plus d'une cinquantaine de solutions spécialisées permettent de faire vivre les opérations de ce secteurs.

Conseiller et accompagner l'équipe du Services-conseils en gestion de patrimoine et partenaires dans le positionnement, la planification, le développement, la réalisation et les suivis relatifs à divers projets et mandats stratégiques sous votre responsabilité

Cibler et analyser des problématiques, soulever les enjeux de taille et faire des recommandations aux instances concernées

Représenter votre vice-présidence auprès de différents comités composés de membres de la haute direction et auprès des instances



Conditions particulières



Lieu de travail : Présentement en télétravail régulier découlant du contexte de la pandémie. Place d’affaires Montréal ou Lévis, selon la préférence du candidat retenu. Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le Mode hybride 

Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1




Profil recherché




Baccalauréat dans une discipline appropriée 

Un minimum de huit ans d'expérience pertinente, dont cinq ans en architecture de systèmes dans un milieu de l'assurance ou financier

Expérience dans la réalisation de dossiers d’architecture dans le cadre de projets d’envergure

Expérience dans l’élaboration de solutions basées sur les technologies web (.Net et/ou Java) dans divers contexte d’utilisation

Expérience en implantation de progiciels en secteur assurance ou financier (un atout)


Veuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considérées


Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaire



Connaissances spécifiques 



Maîtriser des concepts de gouvernance TI

Maîtriser des patrons d’architecture (intégration de solution d’entreprise)

Connaissance des processus d’opération et support des actifs TI – ITIL (un atout)

Expertise avancée en infrastructure technologique (un atout)



Compétences transversales Desjardins


Apprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’action


Compétences clés au profil recherché


Coopérer, Faire preuve d’esprit stratégique, Maîtriser les relations interpersonnelles, Stimuler l’innovation


Lieu de travail


Complexe Desjardins Montréal


Syndicat


Non Syndiqué


Date de fin d'affichage


2022-03-25


Famille d'emplois

description:
Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. NV-11

description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.


Job Level


NV-11

As an Application Solutions Architect, in the context of business financing, the various regulatory frameworks and especially the Basel agreements, you lead and influence, from a Desjardins Group perspective, business partners and specialists on solution or business architecture for initiatives that are strategic, complex and innovative. The nature of the files requires extensive and in depth expertise in several technology and/or business fields, covering aspects pertaining to data, applications and infrastructure.

You will make recommendations regarding solution or business architecture, and produce deliverables pertaining to your field as part of files or projects that have a very high degree of operational and conceptual complexity. These will require analysis and an overall, in-depth understanding of the business and the organization. Coordination will be critical. You will be called upon to interact with a very large number of stakeholders in a variety of fields of expertise. As such, you will need highly developed interpersonal skills.

You will serve as expert advisor and subject matter expert, as well as a resource person and coach for senior management and decision-making bodies.


General Information on the Position




Other Working Conditions




Work place : Currently regular telework because of the pandemic. Position located in Montreal. The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work 

Number of job available : 1




Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree in a related field

A minimum of 8 years of relevant experience


Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered


For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required

Advanced knowledge of integration and design patterns

Excellent critical thinking and ability to resolve ambiguities

description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.


Job Level


NV-11

As an application solutions architect, wealth management and life and health insurance, you actively monitor new technologies and system developments for the organization as a whole, with a view to pursuing developments with our business partners. You actively help design solutions to meet the business needs for large-scale projects or programs that leverage architecture and foundation targets and are part of a vast project to upgrade and improve solutions.

You take on, from a Desjardins Group perspective, a leadership and influencer role when interacting with business partners and specialists on solution or business architecture for strategic, complex and innovative initiatives. The nature of the files require extensive and in-depth expertise in several technology and/or business fields, covering aspects pertaining to data, applications and infrastructure.

You make recommendations regarding solution architecture, and produce deliverables pertaining to your field as part of files or projects with a high degree of operational and conceptual complexity. These require analysis and an overall, in-depth understanding of the business and the organization. Coordination is critical. You must interact with a very large number of stakeholders working in different areas of expertise. Interpersonal savvy is therefore essential.

You serve as expert advisor and subject matter expert, as well as a resource person and coach for senior management and decision-making bodies.

More specifically, you are responsible for developing our technological application environments, making sure they are consistent and in alignment with enterprise architecture targets and orientations. You establish and produce the development plan for our applications portfolio in order to achieve corporate targets and orientations, and to assist our business partner in developing financial products based on their business strategy, by influencing initiatives impacting your field of activity so that they are consistent with the established development plan. You participate in and influence the prioritization of initiatives to ensure their alignment with your field's development plan. You ensure compliance with the guidelines related to your area of expertise.


General Information on the Position




Main Responsibilities




Serve as an expert advisor and subject matter expert for projects and mandates specific to your area of expertise and whose scope and impact are significant and may be felt across Desjardins Group. Identify and prioritize projects that combine business and technology and that support business strategies

Advise and assist business partners and specialists with positioning, planning, development, performance and follow-up of various strategic mandates under your responsibility. Organize, manage and deliver guidelines, as needed, on specific technical subjects requiring the consensus of multiple stakeholders

Develop and update policies, standards, architecture targets or technology solutions, taking into account aspects pertaining to data, applications and infrastructures to support your unit's strategic projects and initiatives

Identify and analyze problems. Raise any major issues. Establish frameworks and make recommendations to the decision-making bodies and committees concerned

Represent your unit in dealings with senior management committees and decision-making bodies

Bachelor's degree in a related field

A minimum of 8 years of relevant experience

Experience executing architecture files as part of large-scale projects

Experience developing solutions based on web technologies (.Net and/or Java) for various use cases

Experience implementing insurance or brokerage software (an asset)

Introduction


As an IBM Application Architect, you directly help clients transform their business and solve complex problems. You will define the scope and vision for projects that deliver customized solutions using your knowledge of IBM platforms. You are a technical leader, serving as a liaison among business partners, technical resources, and project stakeholders.


Your Role and Responsibilities


As an IBM Hybrid Cloud Platform Solution Architect, you directly help clients transform their business and solve complex problems. You will define the scope and vision for projects that deliver customized solutions using your knowledge of Cloud platforms. You are a technical leader, serving as a liaison among business partners, technical resources, and project stakeholders.


Your Role And Responsibilities




Conceptualize scalable production solutions and develop software defined cloud platform infrastructure for large Hybrid Cloud engagements

Able to lead, create and close High-Level and Low-Level design deliverables with client architects.

Bring expertise in hybrid cloud platform security governance and compliance.

Proven understanding of hybrid cloud platforms (including OpenShift, IBM Cloud, AWS, Azure, GCP) and key cloud services consumption models and being able to construct cost-effective solutions for our client.

Proven experience in design and management of Linux environments on a hybrid cloud platform.

Proven experience in designing and delivering Cloud platform automation solutions, including software defined infrastructure, network, and storage environment automation.

Design the overall Virtual Private Cloud infrastructure, including server instances, storage instances, subnets, availability zones, etc.

Design the Hybrid Cloud network architecture, including VPN connectivity between regions and subnets

Design and provide advice on the HA / DR strategies for the hybrid cloud solution.

Maintain best practices on managing systems and services across all environments

Collaborate with other teams and team members to develop automation strategies and deployment processes

Understand complex integrations and how changes will affect existing components

Partner with clients advocating and helping them to achieve distinctive, lasting, and substantial business improvements through the adoption of emerging technologies in Cloud.

Collaborate with the offering and practice teams in developing latest assets and accelerators that are market differentiators for our offerings.




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




Cloud solution architect certification in one of the major cloud providers (IBM Cloud, Azure, AWS, GCP) 

Advisory or consultancy experience in technical projects and services

Experience in design and implementing enterprise container solutions utilize Container orchestration engines like Kubernetes or OpenShift

Familiar with data center concepts and best practices, high - availability systems, capacity planning, system performance evaluation, and diagnostic techniques and methodologies.

Experience in on-premises virtualization solutions, including VMWare, oVirt, and OpenStack.

Experience in designing Networking Architecture across public and private cloud platforms.

3+ years of experience in hybrid cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, IBM, GCP)

10+ years of experience in delivering complex and large-scale IT projects

Understanding of architecting in enterprises using agile methodologies

Understanding of Microservices containers & orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)

Must hold a Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency status




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




10+ years of experience in an architect/development lead role

8+ years of experience in architecture design, deployment, and implementation experience

3+ years of experience in deploying workloads in a cloud (IaaS) environment

Understanding of Red Hat ecosystem (OpenShift, Ansible, RH Fuse, RH SSO, etc.)

Expertise in solution infrastructure as code and DevOps automations

Architecture-Design: Cloud-native and Cloud-ready applications (API enabled containerization)

Familiar with IT Operations and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) practices

Familiar with REST API Interface design, API Gateways, Swagger/OpenAPI standard, OAuth

Expertise in Datacenter moves to Cloud



Must hold a Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency status


About Business Unit


IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing, Software Development, and Computers and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
Are you a computational scientist or engineer passionate about working on the frontiers of artificial intelligence? We are looking for a Solutions Architect in Western Canada to help customers solve challenging problems using Artificial Intelligence. Solutions Architects are the primary technical contacts for our customers and engage deeply with application developers and scientific researchers. We need individuals who can develop positive relationships with customers, learn their requirements and work to bring solutions that enable their success.

Your primary responsibilities will be to lead technical customer engagements in Western Canada. You should be comfortable working in a dynamic environment, communicating with a broad range of customers from research organizations to enterprise customers, and have experience with (or the ability to learn about) NVIDIA’s solutions in areas such as AI, Professional Visualization, including media and entertainment (M&E), VDI, and high performance computing. We are laser-focused on helping customers adopt our platform, and you’ll need to be knowledgeable about a broad array of NVIDIA platforms and how to bring those to bear for customer success. Your ability to work independently is important, and you will rely upon your excellent communication skills during consulting engagements. We expect you to work closely with the entire customer team, including sales, program management and business development. Some travel to conferences and customers may be required.



Whatyou’llbedoing




 Develop and demonstrate solutions using NVIDIA’s platforms including state-of-the-art ML/DL, data science, visual computing, and HPC. 

 Engage with customers to develop a keen understanding of their goals, strategies, and technical needs – and help to define and deliver high-value solutions that meet these needs. 

 Assist field business development in guiding the customer through the sales process for GPU Computing products, owning the technical relationship and assisting customers in building creative solutions based on the NVIDIA platform. 

 Provide customer requirements to engineering to foster product and platform improvements. 

 Document what you know and teach others. This can vary from building targeted training for partners and other Solutions Architects, to writing whitepapers, blogs, and wiki articles, to simply working through hard problems with a customer on a whiteboard. 




Whatweneedtosee




 5+ years proven experience as a sales engineer/solutions architect. 

 B.S. in Computer Science, IT or related field, or higher level of education (or equivalent experience) 

 Experience using modern Deep Learning software architectures and frameworks including Tensorflow, PyTorch. 

 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to learn new technologies quickly. 

 Results-oriented, independent and able to multitask effectively with minimal day-to-day direction. 

 Strong written and oral communications skills leading to effective collaboration with management and engineering. 




Waystostandoutfromthecrowd




 Professional Visualization experience with M&E software such as Omniverse and vGPU. 

 Graduate degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. 

 Parallel programming and GPU experience e.g., CUDA. 

 Experience programming embedded platforms e.g., NVIDIA Jetson or similar. 

 Cloud development/deployment experience e.g., Docker and Kubernetes. 

 Experience in data science methods, analysis and languages including Python. 


NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you.

Introduction


The infrastructure running industries likes transportation, energy, insurance, banking or healthcare is quickly changing as the world’s relationship with technology evolves. Companies have more choices than ever before between on-premise, off-premise, or a hybrid approach. Our Infrastructure Architects are responsible for keeping up with the latest and greatest of these changes and using their expertise to deliver solutions that meet the needs of our customers and products.


Your Role and Responsibilities


The Cloud Architect & Principal Engineer will be responsible for designing, optimizing, analyzing, securing, and supporting our Cloud infrastructure, as well as ensuring on-premises devices remain connected and accessible. The ideal candidate understands the fundamentals of their respective Cloud platform and services and can provide value and knowledge in building a secure, reliable, and cost-effective solution.


What You Will Be Doing




You operate as an excellent Cloud Architect but also enjoy executing on your designs as a Principal level Engineer.

Be the SME in your respective Cloud Platform, whether AWS or GCP or IBM Cloud.

Deploy, automate, maintain, and manage Cloud infrastructure to ensure security, performance, scalability and availability of production systems

Evaluate new technology options and vendor products, present cost-benefit analysis to team

Troubleshoot systems and problem-solve across platform and application domains

Expertise in incident and problem management including timely problem identification, successful resolution, and root-cause analysis

Design, build and evolve our production cloud infrastructure, employing automation and infrastructure-as-code (IaC)

Suggest architecture improvements and recommend process improvements

Use your knowledge of AWS / GCP / IBM CLOUD to assist engineering in planning feature development




What You Bring With You




10+ years’ experience in Solution Architecture, Building and Running Large Complex Cloud Solutions (GCP, Azure, AWS) to multiple Clients

You operate as an excellent Cloud Architect but also enjoy executing on your designs as a Principal level Engineer.

5+ years cloud development platforms for GCP / AWS / IBM CLOUD.

Experience with AWS / GCP / IBM CLOUD implementation and a working knowledge of their respective core products.

3+ years of experience with containerization and container management

5+ years of experience architecting and developing cloud Infrastructure and Platform

Understanding of SRE and DevOps principles and agile and scrum methodologies

Hands-on experience troubleshooting net-new cloud infrastructure

Expertise with VMware, Kubernetes, cloud migrations, advanced networking skills, F5 load balancing, 

Scripting and automation proficiency (bash, python, PowerShell, etc.)

Understanding multi-tier architectures, load balancers, scale sets, and databases

Understanding of high availability and multi-zonal architecture with availability zones and global regions

You must be responsive, flexible, and able to succeed within an open collaborative environment

Ability and willingness to stand on-call in a rotational basis

You have experience supporting high traffic and public facing websites, applications, and services that span multiple datacenters and cloud environments

Ability to work independently and be self-driven in your workload and solutioning

Excellent communication, prioritization, and analytical skills

Experience documenting technical requirements

Computer Science background and fundamentals




Required Technical and Professional Expertise


N/A


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


N/A

Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. Introduction


The infrastructure running industries likes transportation, energy, insurance, banking or healthcare is quickly changing as the world’s relationship with technology evolves. Companies have more choices than ever before between on-premise, off-premise, or a hybrid approach. Our Infrastructure Architects are responsible for keeping up with the latest and greatest of these changes and using their expertise to deliver solutions that meet the needs of our customers and products.


Your Role and Responsibilities


The Cloud Architect & Principal Engineer will be responsible for designing, optimizing, analyzing, securing, and supporting our Cloud infrastructure, as well as ensuring on-premises devices remain connected and accessible. The ideal candidate understands the fundamentals of their respective Cloud platform and services and can provide value and knowledge in building a secure, reliable, and cost-effective solution.


What You Will Be Doing




You operate as an excellent Cloud Architect but also enjoy executing on your designs as a Principal level Engineer.

Be the SME in your respective Cloud Platform, whether AWS or GCP or IBM Cloud.

Deploy, automate, maintain, and manage Cloud infrastructure to ensure security, performance, scalability and availability of production systems

Evaluate new technology options and vendor products, present cost-benefit analysis to team

Troubleshoot systems and problem-solve across platform and application domains

Expertise in incident and problem management including timely problem identification, successful resolution, and root-cause analysis

Design, build and evolve our production cloud infrastructure, employing automation and infrastructure-as-code (IaC)

Suggest architecture improvements and recommend process improvements

Use your knowledge of AWS / GCP / IBM CLOUD to assist engineering in planning feature development




What You Bring With You




10+ years’ experience in Solution Architecture, Building and Running Large Complex Cloud Solutions (GCP, Azure, AWS) to multiple Clients

You operate as an excellent Cloud Architect but also enjoy executing on your designs as a Principal level Engineer.

5+ years cloud development platforms for GCP / AWS / IBM CLOUD.

Experience with AWS / GCP / IBM CLOUD implementation and a working knowledge of their respective core products.

3+ years of experience with containerization and container management

5+ years of experience architecting and developing cloud Infrastructure and Platform

Understanding of SRE and DevOps principles and agile and scrum methodologies

Hands-on experience troubleshooting net-new cloud infrastructure

Expertise with VMware, Kubernetes, cloud migrations, advanced networking skills, F5 load balancing, 

Scripting and automation proficiency (bash, python, PowerShell, etc.)

Understanding multi-tier architectures, load balancers, scale sets, and databases

Understanding of high availability and multi-zonal architecture with availability zones and global regions

You must be responsive, flexible, and able to succeed within an open collaborative environment

Ability and willingness to stand on-call in a rotational basis

You have experience supporting high traffic and public facing websites, applications, and services that span multiple datacenters and cloud environments

Ability to work independently and be self-driven in your workload and solutioning

Excellent communication, prioritization, and analytical skills

Experience documenting technical requirements

Computer Science background and fundamentals

Introduction


As an IBM Application Architect, you directly help clients transform their business and solve complex problems. You will define the scope and vision for projects that deliver customized solutions using your knowledge of IBM platforms. You are a technical leader, serving as a liaison among business partners, technical resources, and project stakeholders.


Your Role and Responsibilities


As an IBM Hybrid Cloud Platform Solution Architect, you directly help clients transform their business and solve complex problems. You will define the scope and vision for projects that deliver customized solutions using your knowledge of Cloud platforms. You are a technical leader, serving as a liaison among business partners, technical resources, and project stakeholders.


Your Role And Responsibilities




Conceptualize scalable production solutions and develop software defined cloud platform infrastructure for large Hybrid Cloud engagements

Able to lead, create and close High-Level and Low-Level design deliverables with client architects.

Bring expertise in hybrid cloud platform security governance and compliance.

Proven understanding of hybrid cloud platforms (including OpenShift, IBM Cloud, AWS, Azure, GCP) and key cloud services consumption models and being able to construct cost-effective solutions for our client.

Proven experience in design and management of Linux environments on a hybrid cloud platform.

Proven experience in designing and delivering Cloud platform automation solutions, including software defined infrastructure, network, and storage environment automation.

Design the overall Virtual Private Cloud infrastructure, including server instances, storage instances, subnets, availability zones, etc.

Design the Hybrid Cloud network architecture, including VPN connectivity between regions and subnets

Design and provide advice on the HA / DR strategies for the hybrid cloud solution.

Maintain best practices on managing systems and services across all environments

Collaborate with other teams and team members to develop automation strategies and deployment processes

Understand complex integrations and how changes will affect existing components

Partner with clients advocating and helping them to achieve distinctive, lasting, and substantial business improvements through the adoption of emerging technologies in Cloud.

Collaborate with the offering and practice teams in developing latest assets and accelerators that are market differentiators for our offerings.




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




Cloud solution architect certification in one of the major cloud providers (IBM Cloud, Azure, AWS, GCP) 

Advisory or consultancy experience in technical projects and services

Experience in design and implementing enterprise container solutions utilize Container orchestration engines like Kubernetes or OpenShift

Familiar with data center concepts and best practices, high - availability systems, capacity planning, system performance evaluation, and diagnostic techniques and methodologies.

Experience in on-premises virtualization solutions, including VMWare, oVirt, and OpenStack.

Experience in designing Networking Architecture across public and private cloud platforms.

3+ years of experience in hybrid cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, IBM, GCP)

10+ years of experience in delivering complex and large-scale IT projects

Understanding of architecting in enterprises using agile methodologies

Understanding of Microservices containers & orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)

Must hold a Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency status




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




10+ years of experience in an architect/development lead role

8+ years of experience in architecture design, deployment, and implementation experience

3+ years of experience in deploying workloads in a cloud (IaaS) environment

Understanding of Red Hat ecosystem (OpenShift, Ansible, RH Fuse, RH SSO, etc.)

Expertise in solution infrastructure as code and DevOps automations

Architecture-Design: Cloud-native and Cloud-ready applications (API enabled containerization)

Familiar with IT Operations and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) practices

Familiar with REST API Interface design, API Gateways, Swagger/OpenAPI standard, OAuth

Expertise in Datacenter moves to Cloud



Must hold a Canadian Citizenship or Permanent Residency status

Position Title: 
Enterprise Architect


 


Our very reputable Insurance Client based in Winnipeg Manitoba is looking for an Enterprise Architect to join their team for a full-time role. The ideal candidate must be willing to live or relocate to Manitoba. 


 


This role will be helping to lead an enterprise-wide Cloud (Azzure) migration journey from it's initial phases to delivery. 


 




SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND SCOPE 




 



Reporting to the Director, Enterprise Architecture, the Enterprise Architect is an advisor to the business, supporting business strategy and planning with a focus on the three-five-year roadmap. This role will be leading an enterprise-wide Cloud Migration journey. 



 



The Enterprise Architect is responsible for establishing the technology strategy and roadmap that enables a portfolio to support current and future business capabilities. This is achieved by working with business owners and Lean Portfolio Management to manage the enterprise portfolio, business epics and technology enablers, linking how change opportunities bring the corporation closer to the five-year ambition.



 



The Enterprise Architect:



· Makes decisions that have a major impact on the Corporation’s ability to attain its strategic directions while maintaining a rationalized portfolio that achieves synergy across the enterprise.



· 
Provides direction to individual work units on what are acceptable tactical objectives and plans how to move from tactical to the strategic architectural objectives.


· 
Works closely with leaders of the corporation to modernize and optimize lines of business and address and respond to market disruptors.


· 
Is responsible for monitoring and adopting technology innovations into the corporation’s technical footprint.

 

The Enterprise Architect needs to keep abreast of technology developments that affect systems, particularly those that are strategic in terms of corporate goals and direction. The position needs to understand how peer companies and agencies are leveraging new technologies, so that the Corporation can be positioned to be a “fast follower”.

 


 NATURE
 
AND
 
SCOPE



 



Enterprise Architecture 70%



· Collaborates with Lean Portfolio Management to provide a high-level vision of enterprise solutions and development initiatives.



· 
Reviews, develops, and implements architecture policies and principles.


· 
Builds and maintains a high-level enterprise model of systems, capabilities, and underlying technologies, current and future, that can be the basis for business and IT architecture direction that guides portfolio management.


· 
Assists the Agile Program Management Office (APMO) and Lean-Agile Centre of Excellence (LACE) to identify and design development value streams.


· 
Supports the value streams with adherence to the budget guardrails for retiring solutions (horizon 0).


· 
Participates in the strategy for building and maintaining the architectural runway via Enabler Epics.


· 
Understands and communicates Strategic Themes, and other business drivers for architecture, to System and Solution Architects and non-technical stakeholders.


· 
Drives architectural initiatives via enabler epics in the Portfolio Kanban system and participates in their analysis where applicable.


· 
Influences modelling, design, and coding practices.


· 
Promotes Continuous Delivery Pipeline and DevOps capabilities.


· 
Collects, generates, and analyzes innovative ideas and technologies to use across the business.


· 
Facilitates the reuse of code, components, and proven patterns.


· 
Ensures the implementation of each capability is designed for reuse and is only built once across the enterprise, where possible.


· 
Synchronizes the following disciplines across Solutions whenever applicable:


· 
System and data security and quality


· 
Production infrastructure


· 
Solution user experience (Lean UX)


· 
Non-functional Requirements (NFRs)


· 
Advises senior leaders, business, solution, system and data architects in accomplishing the overall objectives of the Enterprise Architecture.


· 
Communicates vision and leads technical staff in creating components of the Enterprise Architecture.

 


Research and Strategy 15%



· Supports the selection and use of technology, including identifying and monitoring new technologies that may offer opportunities in the future, researching and prototyping through a proof of concept engagement with business partners, understanding the applicability and scope, and assessing the maturity of innovative new technologies.



· 
Works closely with the Business, Solution and System Architects to ensure that individual program and product strategies align with business and technical objectives and satisfy business vision i.e. emerging solutions to local problems are consistent with the overall enterprise strategy.


· 
Develops and maintains plans for infrastructure, working with System Architects to assess the health of the technology, set principles, set in place epic enablers to address health issues and establish roadmaps.


· 
Works closely with the Business, Solution and System Architects to provide oversight to change initiatives, enabling channels of communication for coordination of work between solution and development value streams.


· 
Responsible for building the technical foundation needed to support business epics into the architectural runway delivering enablers just in time to support emerging business capabilities ensuring a continuous delivery pipeline is maintained and does not inhibit delivery velocity.

 


Architecture Matrix Leadership 15%



· Provides leadership to architects (system, data, business, security) on a matrix basis. Provides mentorship, feedback, and direction on approach and work solutions.



· 
Participates in the selection process, as required, and provides input on performance of matrix reporting resources.


· 
Participates in planning and budgeting for special projects and improvement initiatives.


Supports the implementation of new policies and procedures and corporate strategic initiatives 

Identifies training and development needs, ensuring technical expertise of the unit is maintained.

Participates on committees, cross-functional teams, and in meetings and other ad-hoc working groups established to address customer-service issues and initiatives at strategic and operational levels.



 




QUALIFICATIONS




1. Education:



· Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.



· SAFe Architect Certification or commitment to complete within 12 months.



 



2. Experience:



· Seven years of experience in information technology covering a wide range of technologies and disciplines, including:



· 
Five as an architect


· 
Three as a lead architect


· 
Experience of business transformation using lean/six sigma principles is an asset.

 


Technical Knowledge and Skills:



Working knowledge of application development using a variety of technologies including client/server and relational database technology.

Working knowledge of technology deployment using a variety of technologies including networking and platforms.


· Experience in large-scale, enterprise-wide, end-to-end Cloud migration 


· 
Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to problem solve and recommend solutions to enhance operations to improve service delivery.


· 
Advanced oral and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey complex information in a concise and straightforward manner, including formal presentations for management and technical staff.


· 
Interpersonal skills with ability to build relationships with business partners.


· 
Working knowledge of project management techniques.


· 
Ability to work in an environment that requires multiple on-going activities, which have tight deadlines and a degree of risk.


· 
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and provide leadership and influence the performance of others.


· 
Ability to solve problems and find creative solutions that meet business needs while maintaining the best interests of the corporation.


· 
Intermediate knowledge of applicable software (Microsoft Office, Project, Visio, SQL, and data analysis / management toolsets, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook applications).


· 
Working knowledge of insurance corporate systems is an asset.

525143BR


Introduction


As an AWS Solution Architect, you will lead IBM into the future by translating system requirements into the design and development of customized systems in an agile environment. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into code and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make an impact!


Your Role and Responsibilities


We are currently seeking experienced AWS (Amazon Web Services) Solution Architects to support our clients. Summary of job functions include:



Develops AWS architectural designs that includes - IaaS, Networking, App Services, Databases, etc.

Designs, documents, and implements strategies around Cloud and DevOps

Leads customer workshop, capability demonstration, proof of concept of offering for first of a kind, unknown, or complex situations

Leads technical discussions with customers at varying levels (IT, Business)

Leads or performs the installation and/or management of the physical or operational elements of the system, including network management, operating system, application platforms, and database components.

Provides in-depth knowledge of the AWS Ecosystem and evaluates the customer’s business and technical requirements as a trusted advisor

Provides documentation of the technical design which express what actions a solution must take and what outcome is expected

Supports multiple clients across multiple technologies

Mentors junior team members

Participates in business development activities, from opportunity identification, qualification, scoping, solutioning, proposal writing, orals presentations and demonstrations




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




At least 5 years of IT industry experience

At least 3+ years consulting experience with enterprise technologies in support of distributed applications

At least 2+ years of experience performing architectural solution design

Demonstrated presentation skills and comfortable speaking in front of others

Strong, first-hand experience of designing, building and supporting Enterprise solutions

Able to guide and teach customers and partners on how best to apply AWS technologies in order to meet complex requirements. Proactively supports team members, as needed.

Experience in the full product lifecycle including: Concept generation, Design, Build and Support essential.

At least 1+ years of experience delivering various projects involving AWS (Amazon Web Services) including, but not limited to, AWS EC2, AWS EKS, AWS S3, AWS Lambda

Network technologies as they relate to AWS networking, including: Route53 and load balancing, Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC), and AWS Direct Connect

Disaster recovery and site replication solutions experience

AWS Solution Architect – Associate Certification or SysOps Admin Certification




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




Preference will be given to candidate(s) with AWS Solution Architect – Professional

Complex architecture design, build & delivery in the enterprise

Multi-Cloud knowledge of Azure, Google Cloud, IBM Cloud considered an asset

Strong technical Linux experience - Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA) or Red Hat Certified Engineer (RHCE) preferred

Readiness to travel up to 4 days a week (home on weekends-based on project requirements)

Has Canadian federal government security clearance or is willing and capable of obtaining the same.

Bilingual in French is preferred



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.

Introduction


As a Technical Architect, you will lead IBM into the future by translating system requirements into the design and development of customized systems in an agile environment. Your Responsibilities Include


We are looking for a highly effective Solutions Architect to join our MARTECH team. Your focus will be on Solution Architect of applications that use data to drive Experiences using various Marketing Integrated Solution Vendor (ISV) platforms.



Plan, design, and build XDM schemas to host imported data.

Execute technical feasibility assessments and project estimates to help clients achieve rapid time-to-value from MARTECH technology.

Analyze customer use case, available data to prepare for data modeling (i.e. XDM & mix-ins) that meet customer requirements.

Implement data structures that meet the functional and non-functional project requirements in the implementation, enhancement, and support of marketing projects.
